title: How to deal with noisy people - Quora

response.answer_text: You sound like a Highly Sensitive Person. I’m one, too. My suggestions would be to read Elaine Aron’s book by that name, to help you understand how you’re wired and how to work with it. Loud TVs, loud people, bright lights all stress me out. Other people’s moods can overwhelm me. Don’t stay overnight in their house, period. Limit your time there to a manageable amount, say, one meal. Duck out for a walk when you feel you’re getting overloaded. Meet them at a restaurant if at all possible. Take exceptionally good care of yourself before and after any such visits— quiet time, reading, naps, meditation, quiet walks, etc. Work to accept (even celebrate) your sensitivity, and adopt an unapologetic mindset about it. Dr. Aron says HSPs are about 25% of the population. You’re normal!

I normally have a few simple options. This one is always the best. I just leave the room and go do other things.If I cannot leave, I put earbuds in. Metal is great for drowning out unwanted ear rape.This one either works or has no effect, but I just ask that person to be quiet. Hopefully the one making noise isn’t an asshole.
